name: Nine Zero Hotel - a Kimpton Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent a long time researching which hotel to stay in for a 3 day holiday to Boston and was sure i'd picked the right place. One the plus side the location is great and we had a fantastic view overlooking Boston Common. When we arrived the check in staff were helpful. I also really appreciated the free coffee in the lobby every morning. The wine reception at 5pm is a great idea but we didn't get to try this out.
reviews.title: Disappointed by Nine Zero

reviews.text: However, we had numerous small complaints which spoiled our enjoyment: the bathroom was dirty and tired-looking, the CD player was broken, the sheets were torn, we were disturbed by hotel staff when we had the privacy sign displayed, we were given someone else's bags when we came to check out. These may be only small matters but they meant that I wished I'd stayed next door at the Parker Omni Hotel!
reviews.title: Close to perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Again, on the plus side, when I did complain we were offered a free night's stay at a future date.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just stayed at the nine zero hotel for three nights. I was able to get a 189/night rate through travelzoo. I loved the wine hour each night. I called to the first desk upon checking in and inquired about a cooler or fridge and they immediately brought a refridegator up to the room. Since I signed up for the preferred customer program (it's free) they left a complimentary bottle of water and cholocate. Nice touch.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.text: The room was nice. Very clean and not as small as I thought it was going to be. The staff was very friendly and even treated us to a complimentary breakfast upon check out.
reviews.title: More toward the Zero than the Nine

likes.liked: — views and central location to beacon hill
likes.disliked: — service was either cold or not present

reviews.text: We stayed at Nine Zero for a pre-Christmas visit to Boston with our 10 and 16 year old kids. It's a great hotel in a great location near the Boston Common, the Park Ave T-stop and the Boston Opera House (where we saw the ballet). The rooms are terrific - 2 comfy queen size beds with plenty of additional space for 4 of us to move around. We got an upgrade to the top floor and the view of Boston was spectacular. The staff are very helpful and friendly. My only complaint was that the hotel restaurant was closed on Christmas Eve, so we had to venture outside for our morning coffee. I'm a Kimpton In Touch member and as such got lots of little treats like $10 credit for the mini bar and free cocktail coupons. They definitely treat you well!
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, wonderful service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed a week at the Nine Zero. Wonderful fun place. Excellent room and great service. Great decor and perfect location for seeing the sites. We were there for a week. 2 blocks from the City hall where we got married. Warm smoking area outside with the valet guys who are as nice as can be. Thanks to everyone at Nine Zero for all the fun.
reviews.title: Excellent and Fun Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from Boston and the Nine Zero Hotel. We enjoyed our stay immensely; the hotel staff was extremely efficient and friendly and went out of their way to accomodate us. The rooms were large and comfortable. We will definitely return to Nine Zero on our next visit.
reviews.title: Outstanding! We travel to Boston frequently this was our favorite stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have previously (2008) written a review of this fine establishment. We had booked for this weekend and were so looking forward to spending the night in Boston. We knew that there was a 24 hour cancellation requirement and about 25 hours before, I went to the Weather Channel to make sure all was ok....yeah, weather channel said it was ok at 3pm on Friday but by 9pm they are predicting a MAJOR snowstorm. On the day we were supposed to check in we called Nine Zero at 5AM to cancel and thought we had to beg that they wouldn't charge us the one night fee. We in no way had to beg for anything. The phone was answered in the wee hours by a most pleasant man (Brian) who was very cordial and understood we didn't want to get stuck in Boston in over a foot of snow with Blizzard conditions. He said of course there would be no charge to us. The reason I am writing this review is to let all know what wonderful folks work here and how well you are treated. After 9/11 friends were to stay at a resort in NH who refused to reimburse their deposit under any circumstances..circumstances being there were NO planes flying. This hotel thinks of patrons first not their bottom line.
reviews.title: Were unable to keep our reservation

reviews.text: We will be back to Nine Zero very soon as we love the rooms, the personnel, the wine hour, the location and the overall friendliness of employees like Brian.
reviews.title: Trendy with lots of extras
Comfortable and interesting room
reviews.text: Just returned from three nights at Nine Zero Hotel in Boston and was pleasantly surprised. Read that the rooms were small and they were but the extra's more than make up for it. Nicely furnished room, ergonomically correct chairs, featherbeds with mohair throws. Aveda amenities and a marble tile shower with nice extras light great lighting. Tiger patterned robes and socks, cds you can rent and the service was great.
Ordered a pot of tea the first night and arrived within 5 minutes still very hot. Morning I left ordered breakfast and had some of the best pancakes I have ever eaten.
reviews.title: Kimpton Excellence

reviews.text: Nice wine tasting every night between 5 and 6 and great location. Across from Boston Common and the T and within walking distance to Fanuel Hall and Downtown Crossing. Try this place..........wont disappoint.
reviews.title: Great location, service and style

reviews.text: HIwe stayed here for 4 nites during the boston marathon. well pampered travelers and hotelados, we thought this was a very decent hotel. nice decor, decent size rooms, great restaurant, very central within walking distance from everything. Service is good, nothing to complain there. All the staff are very friendly and helpfull. We normally do not like hotels that allow pets, but this was clean enough for our liking.
reviews.title: Very OK hotel?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We liked the little touches like the martini kits, and the design interior, which is fine and not over the top (the lightswich is actually a switch, and its easy enough to find how the taps
reviews.title: Great location, great service, great views possible, great staff...

likes.disliked: — still can't get used to $500ish prices...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: work :-) Also the free drink reception at 5 with good wine and softdrinks makes one feel very welcome
reviews.title: If only I could live here

likes.liked: — The comfortable feeling throughout the hotel

reviews.text: No gym/pool though which i find a negative.
reviews.title: 3 in a King Size Bed?

reviews.text: We normally stay at the 4seasons which is the complete opposite as fas design is concerned, this hotels compares favourably especially when you compare the prices.
reviews.title: Won't Stay Again

reviews.text: Great location, great views, great food and great service!!!! Loved everything about it
reviews.title: Love this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very good hotel in a great location! Easy walking distance from all the main downtown locations - right on the Freedom Trail. The staff are helpful and pleasant. The hotel is clean and very nicely decorated. Rooms very good and pretty quiet considering the central location. Our bed was really comfortable although (a queen) a little smaller than some in the US. Would probably have given 5/5 had we not had a slight problem with a breakfast (which was eventually fixed to our satisfaction!) and had the wine (and bizarrely the glasses!) not run out just before the end of the free wine reception [admittedly we got there about 5 mins before the end!]. All in all a super hotel and would definately use it next time in Boston!
reviews.title: Good hotel; ideal location

reviews.text: A very, very good hotel with great service. Extremely clean everywhere, even elevators and corridors. Spacious rooms, modern style and great bed. I couldn’t believe that rooms are exactly the same as on photos for hotel presentation! No surprises at all. The hotel location cannot be beat as it was central and an easy walk anywhere. Close to sightseeing bus stops also. I will live here again. I recommend it.
reviews.title: Clean, good location, rooms same as on photos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very good Hotel with great service. Spacious rooms with great bed and a very well furnished frigobar. The location could not be better. You are just in front of a great park and the Freedom Trail. A walking distance to great historical places. I recommed it.
reviews.title: Best Location in Boston

reviews.text: LOVELY hotel - beautiful rooms, amenities and dining. Meeting space is fine. Small property allows for fantastic service but also great privacy. Location is great for town activities, theatre district, public garden & etc.
reviews.title: Do it if you can swing it ...
Loved it!
reviews.text: We stayed with our 4 months baby for 2 nights, from July 28 to July 30. The room was really nice, and staff helpfull. The hotel is perfectly located, near of the Freedom Trail, Quincy Market and Botanic Garden.

reviews.title: Nine Zero Hotel - Best Boutique Hotel in Boston
reviews.text: We'll definitly return to this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Exceptional concierge, front desk, and bell/car service. A beautifully appointed boutique hotel in an excellent central location on Tremont Street near Beacon Hill. Great for business and personal travel ... they treat everyone like royalty!
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just had a great three days in Boston.
reviews.title: Great Experiences at Nine Zero

reviews.text: This Hotel has a great location, clean and reasonbly priced.
reviews.title: great boutique hotel

likes.disliked: — everything in Boston is overpriced including this one, but what can you do when they all are

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying at Nine Zero was a terrific experience. The hotel is extremely well situated, is modern and full of design and the beds, the room ammenities, etc. are top notch.
reviews.title: Always a bit over your expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But what makes Nine Zero deserve an "excellent" in my review is their excellent service and the way they manage to surprise you with something extra, surpassing your expectations, being the complimentary pass to a gym nearby (even theirs is small but completely well furnished), an invitation to breakfast or the wine hour every evening, perfect for getting ready to hit the night in Boston.
reviews.title: First Trip to Boston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We suffered a (false) fire alarm - and were staying in the 18th floor - but, even then, seeing how they managed it, we felt we were in an excellent property.
reviews.title: Second stay in a Kimpton Hotel

reviews.text: Great hotel! Friendly helpful staff. Our 16th floor room was very quiet, did not hear anything outside the room. We had the coffee maker in the room and daily local paper delivered to the room each day. Also enjoyed the daily wine event in the late afternoon. Location is central to all historical sites, T stop is about a block away. Hotel had bottle of wine and chocolate covered strawberries sent up to our room for our anniversary. We stayed in a king view room, had a great view of Boston Commons. Hotel KO restaurant was closed 2 of our 4 nights there, but MOOO just around the corner was a fabulous place! Sun & Mon nights they have $35 prix fix menu available. Also, Lounge 6b across from MOOO has a wonderful spiced pumpkin martini! Nine Zero is our choice for our next trip to Boston!
reviews.title: I Love Kimpton Hotels and Nine Zero Is No Exception.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved this hotel! Ben took our bags to our room - the 19th floor! View of the common was great, could see across Charles River and beyond. Staff all great (especially Ben.) Disappointed that restaurant KO Prime was not open two of the three nights we were there, but Ben (yes, Ben again) recommended Moooo at XV Beacon. Wonderful beyond description. Will seek out a Kimpton again, also stayed at the Argonaut in San Francisco - different but same quality.
reviews.title: Worth the money!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did like the hotel and apart from receptions complete hash of things we did enjoy our stay, but getting it all wrong at the start did put a downer on the whole event, which is a shame as the other staff were very helpful and polite.
reviews.title: best dog friendly hotel

likes.liked: — Excellent service, friendly staff and dog-friendly

reviews.text: This was a stylish hotel. But my room was dirty and that can pretty much ruin it all. When I arrived it was clear that there were rings and spots on the bathroom sink/countertop and it was evident that the desk had not been cleaned in a while. I had work to do so the idea of setting my paperwork on what appeared to be coffee stains was not appealing. When the manager came to check on this and clean it, he first indicated that nothing needed to be cleaned, but he would try. He said the spots were hard water, old stains, etc. Whatever... miraculously they all came off when he sprayed the surfaces with cleaner and wiped. The next day, it seemed that the housekeeper was not too attentive to her duties. There was no attention to detail. Also the robe hanging in the bathroom was worn enough that I did not want to put it on. The best thing about the place was the restaurant attached to the hotel. Now that was good. But it's more important for me to feel like I'm in a really clean room, so I wouldn't choose to stay here again.
reviews.title: Everything was Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was are first stay at Nine Zero. Right from the start we were made to feel special and our room was upgrade with-out having to ask. They put us on the 18th floor facing Boston Common,"what an incredible view." This was are dogs first trip to the hotel also, she was treated very well. My husband doesn't let strangers watch our dog, but he felt very comfortable leaving Skye with them. They put our minds at ease and didn't hesitate to take our dog (a husky.) I would highly reccomend this hotel to any dog lover. The dogsitting rates are resonable and you will never have to worry, just go out and enjoy the city. When you get back you can be sure that your dog was well treated and maybe even spoiled just a little. Ours was, right down to the evening walk that they took her on while we were gone. Again when going to the city with your pet, you should consider Nine Zero they are very pet friendly. Thanks so much for our enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Nine Zero Pet Friendly and More

reviews.text: Fondly,
reviews.title: Nice, but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is not a bad walk to both Quincy Market and the North End. We liked the location alot.
reviews.title: Made Our Anniversary Memorable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a Kimpton member I got free wireless internet in our room and that was convenient.
reviews.title: Phenomenal

reviews.text: I just stayed at the Nine Zero for a conference, and the hotel was in a perfect location, close to the T and right across from the Common. Staff were friendly and helpful, and I was given a free upgrade on arrival to a "view room." I got a great deal through Travel Zoo, and as a Kimpton In Touch member I had free wireless and a credit for the minibar. The room was decorated beautifully, the bed was comfy, and the marble bath was nice. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it highly.
reviews.title: Great deal, fab location, wonderful staff!

reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights over MLK weekend with our 11 year old son. The hotel is right on the Freedom Trail and a minute or so walk from the Park Street T station. We found the location super convenient for walking the city, jumping on the T and having our friend drive us to/from Logan Airport. Our room was clean and spacious. The bathroom was up to date and roomy. We had a lovely view of the Boston Commons and Charles River. Like other Kimpton hotels, the staff was friendly and helpful. These hotels are beautiful and chic, plus warm and comfortable. We've enjoyed Kimpton hotels in Chicago, D.C., N.Y., and now Boston. Also, the Concierge was quite helpful and recommended an amazing seafood spot for Sunday night dinner, The Oceanaire.
reviews.title: Another Amazing Kimpton Property!
Nice location, able & helpful staff
reviews.text: We stayed for one night weekend before Christmas (weekend of big east coast blizzard). Location is good - across from Commons, on Freedom Trail route and a quick walk to North End, Faneuil Hall & Macy's. Bed was comfortable and room size ample for two. Decor is a bit dark, but that's so subjective, I'm sure some tastes will like it. We were able to get pizza delivered to room late night. One hiccup: housekeeping walked in on us about 10am the morning of check out, even tho we had do not disturb sign up. Staff - front desk, valet, bellman - all helpful and friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Nine Zero while in town for a big concert event. The location of the hotel is perfect. Very close to Boston Common and an easy walk to anywhere downtown. The lobby is very tastefully appointed. The walls behind the elevators are decorated with an interesting material that makes you want to touch it each time. We booked two rooms, one for my wife and I and one for a couple that travelled with us. We put in for upgrades online and at check-in, were not told if any room had been upgraded. Only one of the two rooms was upgraded and this would have been nice to know on check-in so we could discuss who would stay in each room. The room my wife and I walked into had nice furtniture, but was incredibly cramped. There was very little room to even move freely around the room. We were a little disappointed. Despite the room issues, I would likely stay here again due to location.
reviews.title: Great Location - Cramped Room

reviews.text: Recently stayed at the Nine Zero with friends in Jan. 2010. Hotel is beautiful - serene, hip, and elegant and decorated in luxurious shades of purple and gray, and covered in gleaming marble. Excellent service from staff. Location cannot be beat - easy walking distance to both Beacon Hill area or downtown with T access at Park Street across the street. Wine reception from 5-6 was a great treat! I will definitely stay at Nine Zero again and next time will bring my pooch! Oh, and my husband! :-)
reviews.title: Could not have been nicer.

reviews.text: The Nine Zero will always be one of those hotels I get very exciting to stay at. A rarity if you ask me. A truly unique and welcoming experience every time I stay here. The Nine Zero has captured this distinctive hotel experience that I can’t say I’ve ever felt. The staff in general is overwhelmingly kind and warm. No matter what requests I make when I stay here, they always meet them and exceed them way above and beyond. Upon check in I was given a voucher for two free mini-bar items thanks to Kimpton Intouch Loyalty program. I was blown away when I entered my room when I saw a bottle wine and a fruit platter. The room itself was perfect. I had windows surrounding my entire room with an excellent view of Boston. The bed was heavenly. Another tremendous benefit of being in the Kimpton Intouch program is the free internet. Hotels of this caliber don’t typically offer complimentary internet. I can always count on the Nine Zero for a remarkable experience. That I don’t usually get anywhere else!
reviews.title: A truly remarkable experience yet again

reviews.text: The Nine Zero is the latest Kimpton jewel I've discovered in my travels. I stayed there for two nights to attend a hockey game at Fenway Park. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. The room was spacious and clean. The mattress was firm. One minor problem -- the shower leaked a little water. But that was the only blemish to report. The staff was courteous and professional especially Mike at the front desk & Fawn who was gracious & provided me with excellent recommendations. The hotel is near the T & within walking distance of Mike's Pastry Shop in the North End. Bravo Kimpton. You've done it again!
reviews.title: Nine Zero is A Number One

reviews.text: From the moment my cab pulled up to the front of the hotel entrance, I knew that this experience was going to be the standard that all other hotels I ever stay at were going to be compared to.
reviews.title: Nine Zero has established a new level of customer service

reviews.text: A key element to this experience is that I want to point out is that I do no look like the normal demographic that would stay at a hotel like this. I am 38, with long hair. Basically, I look like the love child of Ben Franklin, Meat Loaf, and Ted Nugent...with a little dash of Chris Farely thrown into the mix for added flavor.
reviews.title: Another Great Kimpton Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being a wedding photographer/videographer I am constantly working at country clubs and I am constantly snubbed for my "80's rocker hair." They don't know that I grow it for Locks Of Love...a charity that uses my hair to make wigs for children with cancer who have lost their's due to chemo. Most just see the long hair and treat me like the red headed step child. Here at your hotel, I might as well been at the counter of Guitar Center. They made me feel right at home.
reviews.title: Phenomenal experience at Nine Zero Hotel in Boston
Great Trendy Location
reviews.text: The fantastic Nine Zero hotel is located in the heart of the city. Just steps from Boston Common. The nearby Trolley stops are very close and will run about 25.00USD for a "jump on jump off" pass. The hotel is super trendy and some may feel over powered by its sheer moderness. However most find this hotel to be a good value and very clean. I stayed personally at this hotel last year and loved every minuet of it. The front desk staff is very helpful and kind. The onsite manager is very helpful.
The hotels staff is more than willing to help you find nearby attractions such as Cheers, Fenway Park, Freedom Trail, Fleet Center or the New England Aquarium.
reviews.title: Marvellous!
Loved it!
reviews.text: The hotel also has a fantastic upscale eatery called Spire. Spire can be quite expensive, but well worth the money. I apple martini will run you about 12.50USD. The hotel provides a wide range of deserts. Please do not expect to sit in the eatery and expect to just have desert, you will be asked to move to the bar area.

Since the hotel is located centrally hailing a cab is no problem. The hotel is also only about a 20 minuet cab ride from Logan International Airport. The "big dig" or the massive construction effort sometimes slows this time down.
reviews.title: Wonderful staff, great experience!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 3 nights with my husband and 3 other couples. The hotel location cannot be beat as it was central and an easy walk anywhere. Took the Super Tour upper deck bus on the first day to get the highlights and then we walked everywhere from the harbour through the North End (amazing italian restaurants), past Union Oyster House and Bell in Hand for great drinks and then up through Beacon, Back Bay and Copley with a view of great history at every corner. LOVED IT!
reviews.title: Amazing Location and Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel had great service and is super cool. They accommodated our group by getting us all up on the 9th floor. Free wine reception was nice. All the rooms are very modern and clean. We had the smallest with zero view (room 900) and our friends in 912 and 911 had slightly larger rooms with slightly better views. At the end of the day, we spent minimal time in our rooms so the location and comfy beds with walk in showers were the highlight.
reviews.title: Great stay, great location in downtown Boston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used the gym one morning (2 treadmills, 2 bikes, 2 ellipticals with weights and tvs). Free bottled water and apples. Very nice. In the winter, it could be crowded but in September, we were the only ones there.
reviews.title: Great location, nice hotel - one small problem

reviews.text: Right next door to Beantown pub, around the corner from Starbucks and TJMaxx, Marshalls, and Macy's for anyone looking for a quick shopping fix.
reviews.title: Nice location, lovely room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I traveled to Boston on Labor Day weekend with my wife; we were in town to watch my first game at Fenway and also to see what Boston had to offer. Originally, I searched for hotels closer to Fenway, but they were booked, so I found Nine Zero and after reading details and reviews, made my decision to stay here. Great deal on a government rate for our stay of 5 days. I had little to no knowledge of Boston, but I'm glad I chose this Kimpton hotel because (as usual), it was great and made for a comfortable and pleasurable stay. We've stayed at several Kimptons in the past and each one has delivered quality, and this was no different. Our room was spacious and comfortable; we were upgraded to a King room with a view that overlooked Boston Common, the Public Garden, and we could see Fenway in the distance. A spectacular view for a great location; I'm glad we didn't' get stuck with a view of the alley or back of the hotel like some others apparently have; guess we were lucky. The only slightly negative thing that I noticed about the room was that it was apparent that the furniture was old and had been through some tough times; scratch marks and signs of wear and tear on the desks, the chairs, the night stands, and some of the doors were all visible. And yes, like others have said, the TV in the room was one of those old HUGE flat front and gigantic back TVs... could probably use an upgrade. But oh well, we didn't spend our trip in our room so things were satisfactory. Yes, it's a pet hotel, but I can't recall seeing more than a few pets around and we were never bothered by noise of any kind, from guests or pets or anything, so no issues there
reviews.title: Great Staff, Trendy Hotel
Unfortunately a disappointment a second time aroung
reviews.text: This was my second time at the Nine Zero. My first time was in August and I was so excited about the hotel that I recommended it to our company's travel and event services. Everything (except the extremely poor service in the Spire restaurant) was excellent. I couldn't wait to go back! And I do not say this lightly - I'm a very seasoned traveller and have over 50 hotel nights per year. This is not a cheap place (I paid $400 per night, but it was worth it).

So, with great expectations I returned in October. I'm a very light sleeper so my assistant had requested a quiet room on a high floor. (And last time it worked perfectly). Not such luck this time although thispreference is also clearly stated in my Kimpton frequent quest profile. I was given a room 1502 - high floor, but so much street noise that I had 3 very poorly slept nights.
reviews.title: Great trendy hotel

reviews.text: The housekeeping, which as impeccable last time, left a lot of room for improvement this time around: the empty shower gel bottle stood in the shower for 3 days and a new one was not provided until I called and requested one (most annoying when you're wet in the shower already and notice this). The sheets were so worn that there literally was a hole in it! You would expect this in a cheap budget hotel but not in a place like Nine Zero...
reviews.title: Great hotel, friendly helpful staff

likes.disliked: — Elevator out of order for a little bit too long to be acceptable

reviews.text: Then the room service. On both mornings I ordered a big pot of green tea. On the first day the pot of hot water came with 8 tea bags (which was a bit excessive, but at least enough) on the second morning I just got one (with a big pot of water and with at $10 price tag not quite what I expected). When I requested a second tea bag from the waitress, I was told that I can have one only if I pay extra ($5). Granted, I'm on an expense account and it doesn't matter, but this kind of greediness gives a very poor overall impression of the hotel's mentality.
reviews.title: Great location, low on biz traveler standards

likes.liked: — Stylish decor, super comfortable beds, view

reviews.text: And about the Spire restaurant; the menu had 3 seafood choices (I don't eat meat) of which 2 were "sold out". What was most annoying was that we were not told about this in the beginning, but only after we had already made our selections. At that point the waitress told us: "Oh, we don't have that anymore tonight. No, that neither."
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel!

likes.liked: — the front staff and great bed

reviews.text: My husband surprised me with a trip to Boston for our anniversary and booked a room at the Nine Zero. This hotel is fantastic. From the rooms, to the service, to the location. I can not say one bad thing about this hotel. Our room was very hip and comfortable. The hotel has a great restaurant on the premise, hosted a wine hour in the afternoon and recommended a wonderful little wine bar near the Common. I would definitely stay here if you are looking for a quite, hip place to stay in the heart of Boston.
reviews.title: Fabulous place to stay!

reviews.text: Boston is a very walkable city and the Nine Zero Hotel is perfectly located. I am partially handicapped but I was able to walk to Newbury St, Copley Plaza, Boston Common, Beacon Hill,Freedom Trail, Fanueil Hall, Paul Revere House, North Church and the North Side. Remember, many of the sidewalks are uneven bricks so be careful when walking. Make sure you buy tickets to the Freedom Trail Tour. Michael was our tour guide and was excellent. A must to understand Boston and our history. Loved the cemeteries-amazing they date back to the 1600's.
reviews.title: Perfect Location To Walk Boston

reviews.text: Breakfast-walk to the Paramount on Charles St. Stand in line, order, pay and they will seat you. Line moves quickly.
reviews.title: Super hotel, excellent chain

reviews.text: Lunch-Legal Seafood. Loved the chowder and clam roll.
reviews.title: Solid hotel choice in a central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner-Union Oyster House for history and good food. Mooo on Beacon St for maybe one of the best dinners we've had. Ordered the Delmonico steak and caramelized scallops. Share the sides of mashed potatoes, Parmesan fries, don't miss the corn succotash and creamed spinach. Finished with warm blueberry pie with vanilla ice cream. Worth the $150 for 2. We've paid more for dinner butbhave never had better.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Service in a Great City
Great location and great hotel!!!
reviews.text: Just stayed at the Nine Zero Boston and LOVED it. The location was great. Right next to Boston Commons and very close to other areas such as the Back Bay, the North End, Quincy Market, etc. The hotel was clean and decorated very nicely. They had a nightly turndown service and left you little treats each night. It was very quiet as well. We stayed in a King Premier room and really liked it. It was not huge but just fine for two adults. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful as well. Next time we are in Boston we'll be sure to stay at the Nine Zero again.

This last time (the third time I've stayed at the Nine Zero), I had actually been booked into another hotel by the travel department at my company. That hotel, however, lost my reservation. To top it off, it was the weekend of St. Patrick’s Day - not the time to be looking for a hotel! That hotel called NineZero and verified that not only did they have rooms, but at a discount price! I finally got settled, had excellent room service after midnight, and came home each night to soft jazz playing on the CD player. Great experience and very convenient to downtown activities. I let the concierge decide what seafood restaurant to eat at each night and tell me where the best night spots were. Great picks each time.
reviews.title: 3rd time - and still my choice!

reviews.text: Booked with their central reservation and got the best deal. Friendly welcoming staff. Very quiet rooms, even though the hotel was fully booked didn't hear anyone in my room and only saw one person on the elevator.

Have stayed here twice for business, and have had nothing but good experiences. The staff was wonderful - attentive and knowledgeable, arranging for transportation and recommending and good bar in the vicinity. The lobby was small, but beautifully designed. As I entered the room, soft music played on the Bose machine. The contemporary decor was streamlined and elegant without being cold. The bathroom was spacious and clean.

reviews.text: Taking all the above into consideration, I have stayed in worse hotels and perhaps I just has a bad room. However following all the other glowing reviews I did have higher expectations for my stay.
reviews.title: Good, but some glitches
Kimpton excels again with 9-0
reviews.text: I stayed here with my husband on our wedding night in late August, a few months ago. It is a wonderful property, modern/swanky/low profile feel. Due to a corporate rate I have, we stayed here at $300/night for a "Spectacular Room" (I think Kimpton may have changed the room names now), but were supposedly upgraded to a nicer room since it was our wedding night. The room was beautiful, with large windows and a gorgeous view of Boston from the bed. The bathrooms were very roomy and nice as well. I am very surprised about the complaints here about the service. Service was over the top excellent during our stay, and we asked for a lot of different things. I thought they were great and seemed accustomed to providing high level service. We ate at their Spire restaurant for brunch with our families the morning afterwards, and it was great. The only hassle at all was that they accidentally billed us twice for the room and on wrong credit cards (we used different ones to reserve), but it was quickly fixed with a phone call. Regardless, I'm very glad I stayed at Nine Zero on our wedding night and am eager to stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night to catch an early flight. Our friends were travelling with us and we all agreed our stay at Nine Zero was probably the single best hotel expereince we've ever had. We travel quite a bit and go to New York and Boston a couple times a year for long weekends. We look for the best deal and make our decisions based on Trip Advisor reviews, always! Back to Nine Zero...a week before we left for Boston we received an e-mail from the manager offering assistance during our trip. They reserved tour tickets for us and couldn't have been nicer, like our own personal consierge. When we checked in, the front desk staff were so friendly and helpful, I couldn't believe it. We were early so they got us into one room and then rushed to get the other romm cleaned. They brought up our bags shortly and then ushered us to our room -- both were amazing for standard rooms but ours was a corner room overlooking the park. We loved the hotel so much we didn't even want to go on our tour, which was great too. We did the Duck Tour. When we returned from our tour and dinner (in Little Italy - YUM!) there were robes and chocolates set out! Loved it!!! Can't wait to go back!!!
reviews.title: Great Stay at Nine Zero - loved it!

reviews.text: Reviewer: A Trip Advisor member from San Antonio, Texas.
reviews.title: Nine Zero Good Hotel in Great Location
Two Paws up from Luxury Loving Dog
reviews.text: Family of three (son age 14) stayed 8/11/07-8/15/07. Had reserved standard double queen room (summer special $309 rate), but as a Kimpton in Touch member, upon check-in, we received a free upgrade to a deluxe room with a view on a higher floor. Hotel is very modern in design and execution and is quite attractive throughout. Best of all is the location --adjacent to Boston Common right on the Freedom Trail and only a block from the subway. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful--particularly at the concierge desk. The stay was not without a couple of problems, however. The modern design of the bathroom--and the glass shower in particular--was a problem, in that the shower door leaked water on to the floor and had to be fixed. Also, several channels on the Direct TV feed froze, and required a call to get them working. Finally, the hotel's highly praised restaurant just recently closed--it changed names and format (the previous chef left to open his own reataurant), and the new menu and prices did not look good enough to attract us for dinner. The one breakfast we had there was good, but overpriced. All in all, we really like Kimpton Hotels--the style, the amenities and the people. I recommend the Nine Zero.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a weekend this summer on our way back from Maine with our large, black labrador. Well if you want to be treated like a rock star (or more likely your dog will be treated like one), bring your pet to this hotel. From having your pets name on the reservation, cookies at check in, lavender scented baggies for those delightful waste management moments and doggy room service, this hotel had it all. AND it is right next door to the Boston Common and portions of the Freedom Trail.
reviews.title: It was Wonderful

reviews.text: Combine the doggy amenities with pretty nice ones for non-canines (wine reception, immaculate and comfortable rooms, good food at "KO Prime") and it is hard to go wrong for the pet owner who wants to stay at an interesting city hotel.

reviews.text: Trendy hotel. The staff was very nice and the location is great but the room we stayed in was rather small. Also, you can hear the noise from the outside! But overall it was a nice place. The warm cookies and milk need improvement!

Loved Nine Zero!
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from Boston and the Nine Zero Hotel. We enjoyed our stay immensely; the hotel staff was extremely efficient and friendly and went out of their way to accomodate us. The rooms were large and comfortable. We will definitely return to Nine Zero on our next visit.

The Nine Zero is a modern boutique hotel located in downtown Boston. The outside of the hotel is brick and looks like a lot of the other buildings in this city. However, its insides are quite modern and sleek making for an enjoyable contrast in such a historic town.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a Great location!
Great location but we could hear every sound
reviews.text: The hotel is located on the Freedom Trail directly across the street from the very old Granary Cemetary. Paul Revere, Samuel Adams, and the parents of Benjamin Franklin (among others) are buried there. Our corner room allowed us a terrific people watching view, including the groups taking tours led by people dressed in revolutionary period clothing.

reviews.title: Loved it
reviews.text: Boston is known as a walking city and almost everything is within walking distance from this hotel. The financial district is in one direction and the theater district in another. One edge of Boston Common (the furthest side from the Public Garden) is 1block away to the south. You can choose from high end stores and dining on Newbury Street at the end of the Public Garden or find moderate shopping and fast food on Washinton Street, which is one city block to the east of Nine Zero.

description: The elegant Nine Zero Hotel in downtown Boston is consistently named one of the world's best hotels by Conde Nast Traveler, and was recently voted Boston Magazine's Boston's Best Boutique Hotel. Nine Zero Hotel features impeccable service, sophisticated 4-star style, the acclaimed KO Prime steakhouse and the perfect launch pad for exploring this historic city. The central location means easy access to Beacon Hill, Boston Common, Faneuil Hall and the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston.
